```{.r .cell-code}
pacman::p_load(ggrepel, patchwork, ggthemes, hrbrthemes, tidyverse)

#loading data into exam_data
exam_data <- read_csv("Data files/Exam_data.csv")

#ggrepel
ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x= MATHS, 
           y=ENGLISH)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(method=lm, 
              size=0.5) +  
  geom_label(aes(label = ID), 
             hjust = .5, 
             vjust = -.5) +
  coord_cartesian(xlim=c(0,100),
                  ylim=c(0,100)) +
  ggtitle("English scores versus Maths scores for Primary 3")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-On_Exercise_02_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-1-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
#replacing geom_label() by geom_label_repel() [and geom_text() with geom_text_repel()]
ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x= MATHS, 
           y=ENGLISH)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(method=lm, 
              size=0.5) +  
  geom_label_repel(aes(label = ID), 
                   fontface = "bold") +
  coord_cartesian(xlim=c(0,100),
                  ylim=c(0,100)) +
  ggtitle("English scores versus Maths scores for Primary 3")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-On_Exercise_02_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-1-2.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
#ggplot2 themes
ggplot(data=exam_data, 
             aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_histogram(bins=20, 
                 boundary = 100,
                 color="grey25", 
                 fill="grey90") +
  theme_gray() +
  ggtitle("Distribution of Maths scores") 
```

```{.r .cell-code}
#production workflow
ggplot(data=exam_data, 
             aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_histogram(bins=20, 
                 boundary = 100,
                 color="grey25", 
                 fill="grey90") +
  ggtitle("Distribution of Maths scores") +
  theme_ipsum(axis_title_size = 18,
              base_size = 15,
              grid = "Y")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-On_Exercise_02_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-1-6.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
#plot 1 (histogram Math scores)
p1 <- ggplot(data=exam_data, 
             aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_histogram(bins=20, 
                 boundary = 100,
                 color="grey25", 
                 fill="grey90") + 
  coord_cartesian(xlim=c(0,100)) +
  ggtitle("Distribution of Maths scores")

#plot 2 (histogram English scores)
p2 <- ggplot(data=exam_data, 
             aes(x = ENGLISH)) +
  geom_histogram(bins=20, 
                 boundary = 100,
                 color="grey25", 
                 fill="grey90") +
  coord_cartesian(xlim=c(0,100)) +
  ggtitle("Distribution of English scores")

#plot 3 (scatterplot of English vs Math)
p3 <- ggplot(data=exam_data, 
             aes(x= MATHS, 
                 y=ENGLISH)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(method=lm, 
              size=0.5) +  
  coord_cartesian(xlim=c(0,100),
                  ylim=c(0,100)) +
  ggtitle("English scores versus Maths scores for Primary 3")


p1 + p2
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-On_Exercise_02_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-1-7.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
#combining three ggplot2 graphs
(p1 / p2) | p3
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-On_Exercise_02_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-1-8.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
#tagging capabilities
((p1 / p2) | p3) + 
  plot_annotation(tag_levels = 'I')
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-On_Exercise_02_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-1-9.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
#insert_element()
p3 + inset_element(p2, 
                   left = 0.02, 
                   bottom = 0.7, 
                   right = 0.5, 
                   top = 1)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-On_Exercise_02_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-1-10.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
#combining patchwork and economist theme (from ggtheme)
patchwork <- (p1 / p2) | p3
patchwork & theme_economist()
```

![](Hands-On_Exercise_02_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-1-11.png){width=672}
